Latvia are set to make their League C debut this week.
Armenia have not kept a clean sheet in their last 21 matches.
Armenia returned to winning ways last time out, beating Kazakhstan 2-1.
Saturday's game will mark the fifth meeting between Armenia and Latvia.
Latvia came through the last three games without a win, recording two draws and one loss.
Latvia were ranked 137th in the latest FIFA rankings and now sit 40 places behind Armenia.
Armenia are ranked number 97 in the FIFA world ranking, while Latvia are ranked number 137.
Both teams have been involved in matches with few goals recently, suggesting a close encounter is expected.
Latvia featured in League D of the Nations League in 2022, winning four of their six group games to finish atop their group.
Armenia endured a very poor Nations League campaign in 2022, losing five of their six group games and being relegated from League B.
Latvia faced the Faroe Islands in their most recent outing, picking up a 1-0 win to secure a third-place finish in the 2024 Baltic Cup.
Armenia will face Latvia at the Vazgen Sargsyan Republican Stadium on Saturday in the opening game of their 2024-25 UEFA Nations League campaign.
The two sides last faced off in a European Championship qualifying clash last October, which Latvia won 2-0 despite finishing the game with 10 men.
Armenia lost twice in their last three matches, as they were defeated 2-1 by Czech Republic and 2-1 against Slovenia, but won 2-1 against Kazakhstan.
Armenia take on Latvia at Republican Stadium - Vazgen Sargsyan in one of the matches in round one of the group phase of the UEFA Nations League this season.

The home team, ranked 97th in the FIFA ranking, is in a bad moment of form with only 1 win in their last 10 matches between official and friendly matches. What could definitely help them will be the home factor, as in their last 6 home matches they have managed to win or draw in 4 of them, including the 1-1 draw against Wales.

On the away side, we find the 137th in the world also in a not too positive form but with the precedent of almost a year ago when they won at home the Armenian team by 2-0 in a duel that is remembered of a lot of action where the accuracy in front of goal was key. However, as visitors they will have a big problem, having lost 6 of their last 7 away games.

Eduard Spertsyan is an Armenian footballer who has gained recognition as one of the most promising talents of the Armenian national team. Born on June 7, 2000 in Krasnodar, Russia, he plays as an attacking midfielder and is known for his technique, dribbling ability and ability to create attacking moves. Since his debut with FC Krasnodar in the Russian Premier League, he has proven to be a key player for both his club and the Armenian national team. Spertsyan has scored important goals and has been a key player in Armenia's bid to improve its performance in international competitions.

Latvia's best player is Kristers Tobers is a Latvian footballer who plays as a defensive midfielder or central defender. Born on December 13, 2000, Tobers has been a prominent figure in the Latvian national team, known for his defensive solidity, ability to intercept balls and his versatility on the field. He began his career with FK Liepāja, one of Latvia's top clubs, before moving to Lechia Gdańsk in Poland, where he has continued to develop his skills. Tobers is considered one of the most promising young talents in Latvian soccer, with a bright future both for his national team and at club level.
